alert.note: Alert for Cass; Johnson; Nemaha; Otoe; Pawnee; Richardson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 01 at 3:43PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Nebraska, including the following counties, Cass, Johnson, Nemaha, Otoe, Pawnee and Richardson. * WHEN...Until 9 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow-moving and heavy-rainfall-producing thunderstorms continue to spread southeast across the area this afternoon into evening. Since rainfall over the past couple of days has left soils wet, the anticipated rainfall today will enhance the threat for flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Cass; Johnson; Nemaha; Otoe; Pawnee; Richardson
